intro: Jupunba piresii, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, star-shaped yellow fruits. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments and thrives in well-drained soil. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy green appearance. The fruit is edible, with a sweet and tangy flavor, making it a popular crop in its native region.
